poem:
"In the Dance of Diplomacy"

In myriad rooms aglow,
sage Franklin spins the dance.
Flame gives kisses to ancient wigs,
a virgin's delicate balance.

Courtship, not conquest,
with velvet vow across sea's expanse,
a dowry-gilded promise.
Behold: America's romance.

In this ballroom's intrigue,
bewitched wineglass aloft,
the fragile fall, the swift ascendance,
measured in whispers so soft.

In the spindle of time, so it unrolls,
diplomacy, this seductive dance.
